smp 3.1.1
built with pdoc

smp.image_management

The Simple Management Protocol (SMP) Image Management group.

Notion of "slots" and "images" in Zephyr

The “slot” and “image” definition comes from mcuboot where “image” would consist of two “slots”, further named “primary” and “secondary”; the application is supposed to run from the “primary slot” and update is supposed to be uploaded to the “secondary slot”; the mcuboot is responsible in swapping slots on boot. This means that pair of slots is dedicated to single upgradable application. In case of Zephyr this gets a little bit confusing because DTS will use “slot0_partition” and “slot1_partition”, as label of fixed-partition dedicated to single application, but will name them as “image-0” and “image-1” respectively.

Currently Zephyr supports at most two images, in which case mapping is as follows:

Image Slot labels Slot Names
0 “slot0_partition” “slot1_partition” “image-0” “image-1”
1 “slot2_partition” “slot3_partition” “image-2” “image-3” 
  1"""The Simple Management Protocol (SMP) Image Management group.
  2
  3## Notion of "slots" and "images" in Zephyr
  4
  5The “slot” and “image” definition comes from mcuboot where “image” would consist
  6of two “slots”, further named “primary” and “secondary”; the application is
  7supposed to run from the “primary slot” and update is supposed to be uploaded to
  8the “secondary slot”; the mcuboot is responsible in swapping slots on boot. This
  9means that pair of slots is dedicated to single upgradable application. In case
 10of Zephyr this gets a little bit confusing because DTS will use
 11“slot0_partition” and “slot1_partition”, as label of fixed-partition dedicated
 12to single application, but will name them as “image-0” and “image-1”
 13respectively.
 14
 15Currently Zephyr supports at most two images, in which case mapping is as
 16follows:
 17
 18| Image | Slot labels | Slot Names |
 19|-------|-------------|------------|
 20| 0     | “slot0_partition” “slot1_partition” | “image-0” “image-1” |
 21| 1     | “slot2_partition” “slot3_partition” | “image-2” “image-3” |
 22
 23"""
 24
 25from __future__ import annotations
 26
 27from enum import IntEnum, unique
 28from typing import Generator, List
 29
 30from pydantic import BaseModel, ConfigDict, ValidationInfo, field_validator
 31
 32from smp import error, header, message
 33
 34
 35class HashBytes(bytes):  # pragma: no cover
 36    """Only to print something useful to the `rich` console."""
 37
 38    def __rich_repr__(self) -> Generator[str, None, None]:
 39        yield self.hex().upper()
 40
 41
 42class ImageState(BaseModel):
 43    """The state of an image in a slot."""
 44
 45    model_config = ConfigDict(extra="forbid", frozen=True, arbitrary_types_allowed=True)
 46
 47    slot: int
 48    """Slot number within “image”.
 49
 50    Each image has two slots:
 51    - primary (running one) = 0
 52    - secondary (for DFU dual-bank purposes) = 1.
 53    """
 54    version: str
 55    """Version of the image."""
 56    image: int | None = None
 57    """Semi-optional image number.
 58
 59    The field is not required when only one image is supported by the running
 60    application.
 61    """
 62    hash: HashBytes | bytes | None = None
 63    """SHA256 hash of the image header and body.
 64
 65    Note that this will not be the same as the SHA256 of the whole file, it is
 66    the field in the MCUboot TLV section that contains a hash of the data which
 67    is used for signature verification purposes. This field is optional but only
 68    optional when using MCUboot's serial recovery feature with one pair of image
 69    slots, `CONFIG_BOOT_SERIAL_IMG_GRP_HASH` can be disabled to remove
 70    support for hashes in this configuration. SMP server in applications must
 71    support sending hashes.
 72    """
 73    bootable: bool | None = None
 74    """True if image has bootable flag set.
 75
 76    This field does not have to be present if false.
 77    """
 78    pending: bool | None = None
 79    """True if image is set for next swap.
 80
 81    This field does not have to be present if false.
 82    """
 83    confirmed: bool | None = None
 84    """True if image has been confirmed.
 85
 86    This field does not have to be present if false.
 87    """
 88    active: bool | None = None
 89    """True if image is currently active application
 90
 91    This field does not have to be present if false.
 92    """
 93    permanent: bool | None = None
 94    """True if image is to stay in primary slot after the next boot.
 95
 96    This does not have to be present if false.
 97    """
 98
 99    @field_validator("hash")
100    @classmethod
101    def cast_bytes(cls, v: bytes | None, _: ValidationInfo) -> HashBytes | None:
102        if v is None:
103            return None
104        return HashBytes(v)
105
106
107class ImageStatesReadRequest(message.ReadRequest):
108    """Obtain list of images with their current state."""
109
110    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
111    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.ImageManagement.STATE
112
113
114class ImageStatesReadResponse(message.ReadResponse):
115    """Response to an image state request."""
116
117    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
118    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.ImageManagement.STATE
119
120    images: List[ImageState]
121    """List of images with their current state."""
122    splitStatus: int | None = None
123    """States whether loader of split image is compatible with application part.
124
125    This is unused by Zephyr.
126    """
127
128
129class ImageStatesWriteRequest(message.WriteRequest):
130    """Set the state of an image.
131
132    If “confirm” is false or not provided, an image with the “hash” will be set
133    for test, which means that it will not be marked as permanent and upon hard
134    reset the previous application will be restored to the primary slot. In case
135    when “confirm” is true, the “hash” is optional as the currently running
136    application will be assumed as target for confirmation.
137    """
138
139    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
140    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.ImageManagement.STATE
141
142    hash: bytes | None = None
143    """SHA256 hash of the image header and body."""
144    confirm: bool = False
145    """Confirm the image given by hash.
146
147    CAUTION: it is dangerous to confirm the image before it has been booted!
148
149    Setting this to true will mark the image as confirmed before it has been
150    booted, which can brick the device.  Zephyr provides hooks for confirming
151    the image from within the application, so this is not necessary for normal
152    operation.
153    """
154
155
156class ImageStatesWriteResponse(ImageStatesReadResponse):
157    """Success response to an image state write request."""
158
159
160class ImageUploadWriteRequest(message.WriteRequest):
161    """Upload an image to the device.
162
163    The image is uploaded in chunks, with each chunk being sent in a separate
164    request. The first request must include the image's length and image number.
165    """
166
167    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
168    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.ImageManagement.UPLOAD
169
170    off: int
171    """The offset of the data chunk in this request."""
172    data: bytes
173    """The data chunk to write."""
174    image: int | None = None
175    """Image number.
176
177    It does not have to appear in request at all, in which case it is assumed to
178    be 0. Should only be present when `off` is 0.
179    """
180    len: int | None = None
181    """The length of the image.
182
183    Required when `off` is 0, otherwise ignored.
184    """
185    sha: bytes | None = None
186    """SHA256 hash of the image.
187
188    This is used to identify an upload session (e.g. to allow to continue
189    a broken session), and for image verification purposes. This must be a full
190    SHA256 hash of the whole image being uploaded, or not included if the hash
191    is not available (in which case, upload session continuation and image
192    verification functionality will be unavailable). Should only be present when
193    “off” is 0.
194    """
195    upgrade: bool | None = None
196    """Optional flag that states that only upgrade should be allowed.
197
198    If the version of uploaded software is not higher then already on a device,
199    the image upload will be rejected. Zephyr compares major, minor and
200    revision (x.y.z) by default unless `CONFIG_MCUMGR_GRP_IMG_VERSION_CMP_USE_BUILD_NUMBER`
201    is set, whereby it will compare build numbers too. Should only be present
202    when “off” is 0.
203    """
204
205
206class ImageUploadWriteResponse(message.WriteResponse):
207    """Success response to an image upload request."""
208
209    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
210    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.ImageManagement.UPLOAD
211
212    off: int | None = None
213    """The portion of the upload that has been completed, in 8-bit bytes.
214
215    This is the offset of the next byte to be written. If the offset is equal to
216    the length of the image, the upload is complete.
217    """
218
219    match: bool | None = None
220    """Indicates if the uploaded data successfully matches the provided SHA256.
221
222    Only sent in the final packet if CONFIG_IMG_ENABLE_IMAGE_CHECK is enabled.
223    """
224
225    rc: int | None = None
226    """Legacy field that contains a return code; possibly `MGMT_ERR`.
227
228    This field may be present on old SMP server implementations or new SMP
229    server implementations that have set
230    `CONFIG_MCUMGR_SMP_LEGACY_RC_BEHAVIOUR=y` for backwards compatibility with
231    old SMP clients.
232
233    Note that we are not validating this field because we don't necessarily
234    trust the server to send us valid values. If this value is present, then it
235    indicates use of an SMP server that is out of spec and interpretation of the
236    value should be done with reference to that server's source code, rather
237    that the SMP specification.
238
239    Zephyr source code reference: https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/blob/91a1e706535b2f99433280513c5bc66dfb918506/subsys/mgmt/mcumgr/grp/img_mgmt/src/img_mgmt.c#L397-L400
240    """  # noqa: E501
241
242
243class ImageEraseRequest(message.WriteRequest):
244    """Erase an image from a slot."""
245
246    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
247    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.ImageManagement.ERASE
248
249    slot: int | None = None
250    """The slot to erase. If not provided, slot 1 will be erased."""
251
252
253class ImageEraseResponse(message.WriteResponse):
254    """Success response to an image erase request."""
255
256    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
257    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.ImageManagement.ERASE
258
259
260@unique
261class IMG_MGMT_ERR(IntEnum):
262    """Image management error codes."""
263
264    OK = 0
265    """No error, this is implied if there is no ret value in the response"""
266
267    UNKNOWN = 1
268    """Unknown error occurred."""
269
270    FLASH_CONFIG_QUERY_FAIL = 2
271    """Failed to query flash area configuration."""
272
273    NO_IMAGE = 3
274    """There is no image in the slot."""
275
276    NO_TLVS = 4
277    """The image in the slot has no TLVs (tag, length, value)."""
278
279    INVALID_TLV = 5
280    """The image in the slot has an invalid TLV type and/or length."""
281
282    TLV_MULTIPLE_HASHES_FOUND = 6
283    """The image in the slot has multiple hash TLVs, which is invalid."""
284
285    TLV_INVALID_SIZE = 7
286    """The image in the slot has an invalid TLV size."""
287
288    HASH_NOT_FOUND = 8
289    """The image in the slot does not have a hash TLV, which is required."""
290
291    NO_FREE_SLOT = 9
292    """There is no free slot to place the image."""
293
294    FLASH_OPEN_FAILED = 10
295    """Flash area opening failed."""
296
297    FLASH_READ_FAILED = 11
298    """Flash area reading failed."""
299
300    FLASH_WRITE_FAILED = 12
301    """Flash area writing failed."""
302
303    FLASH_ERASE_FAILED = 13
304    """Flash area erase failed."""
305
306    INVALID_SLOT = 14
307    """The provided slot is not valid."""
308
309    NO_FREE_MEMORY = 15
310    """Insufficient heap memory (malloc failed)."""
311
312    FLASH_CONTEXT_ALREADY_SET = 16
313    """The flash context is already set."""
314
315    FLASH_CONTEXT_NOT_SET = 17
316    """The flash context is not set."""
317
318    FLASH_AREA_DEVICE_NULL = 18
319    """The device for the flash area is NULL."""
320
321    INVALID_PAGE_OFFSET = 19
322    """The offset for a page number is invalid."""
323
324    INVALID_OFFSET = 20
325    """The offset parameter was not provided and is required."""
326
327    INVALID_LENGTH = 21
328    """The length parameter was not provided and is required."""
329
330    INVALID_IMAGE_HEADER = 22
331    """The image length is smaller than the size of an image header."""
332
333    INVALID_IMAGE_HEADER_MAGIC = 23
334    """The image header magic value does not match the expected value."""
335
336    INVALID_HASH = 24
337    """The hash parameter provided is not valid."""
338
339    INVALID_FLASH_ADDRESS = 25
340    """The image load address does not match the address of the flash area."""
341
342    VERSION_GET_FAILED = 26
343    """Failed to get version of currently running application."""
344
345    CURRENT_VERSION_IS_NEWER = 27
346    """The currently running application is newer than the version being uploaded."""
347
348    IMAGE_ALREADY_PENDING = 28
349    """There is already an image operating pending."""
350
351    INVALID_IMAGE_VECTOR_TABLE = 29
352    """The image vector table is invalid."""
353
354    INVALID_IMAGE_TOO_LARGE = 30
355    """The image it too large to fit."""
356
357    INVALID_IMAGE_DATA_OVERRUN = 31
358    """The amount of data sent is larger than the provided image size."""
359
360    IMAGE_CONFIRMATION_DENIED = 32
361    """Confirmation of image has been denied"""
362
363    IMAGE_SETTING_TEST_TO_ACTIVE_DENIED = 33
364    """Setting test to active slot is not allowed"""
365
366
367class ImageManagementErrorV1(error.ErrorV1):
368    """Image Management error response."""
369
370    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
371
372
373class ImageManagementErrorV2(error.ErrorV2[IMG_MGMT_ERR]):
374    """Image Management error response."""
375
376    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
class HashBytes(builtins.bytes):

class ImageState(pydantic.main.BaseModel): 
 43class ImageState(BaseModel):
 44    """The state of an image in a slot."""
 45
 46    model_config = ConfigDict(extra="forbid", frozen=True, arbitrary_types_allowed=True)
 47
 48    slot: int
 49    """Slot number within “image”.
 50
 51    Each image has two slots:
 52    - primary (running one) = 0
 53    - secondary (for DFU dual-bank purposes) = 1.
 54    """
 55    version: str
 56    """Version of the image."""
 57    image: int | None = None
 58    """Semi-optional image number.
 59
 60    The field is not required when only one image is supported by the running
 61    application.
 62    """
 63    hash: HashBytes | bytes | None = None
 64    """SHA256 hash of the image header and body.
 65
 66    Note that this will not be the same as the SHA256 of the whole file, it is
 67    the field in the MCUboot TLV section that contains a hash of the data which
 68    is used for signature verification purposes. This field is optional but only
 69    optional when using MCUboot's serial recovery feature with one pair of image
 70    slots, `CONFIG_BOOT_SERIAL_IMG_GRP_HASH` can be disabled to remove
 71    support for hashes in this configuration. SMP server in applications must
 72    support sending hashes.
 73    """
 74    bootable: bool | None = None
 75    """True if image has bootable flag set.
 76
 77    This field does not have to be present if false.
 78    """
 79    pending: bool | None = None
 80    """True if image is set for next swap.
 81
 82    This field does not have to be present if false.
 83    """
 84    confirmed: bool | None = None
 85    """True if image has been confirmed.
 86
 87    This field does not have to be present if false.
 88    """
 89    active: bool | None = None
 90    """True if image is currently active application
 91
 92    This field does not have to be present if false.
 93    """
 94    permanent: bool | None = None
 95    """True if image is to stay in primary slot after the next boot.
 96
 97    This does not have to be present if false.
 98    """
 99
100    @field_validator("hash")
101    @classmethod
102    def cast_bytes(cls, v: bytes | None, _: ValidationInfo) -> HashBytes | None:
103        if v is None:
104            return None
105        return HashBytes(v)

The state of an image in a slot.

slot: int

Slot number within “image”.

Each image has two slots:

  • primary (running one) = 0
  • secondary (for DFU dual-bank purposes) = 1.
version: str

Version of the image.

image: int | None

Semi-optional image number.

The field is not required when only one image is supported by the running application.

hash: HashBytes | bytes | None

SHA256 hash of the image header and body.

Note that this will not be the same as the SHA256 of the whole file, it is the field in the MCUboot TLV section that contains a hash of the data which is used for signature verification purposes. This field is optional but only optional when using MCUboot's serial recovery feature with one pair of image slots, CONFIG_BOOT_SERIAL_IMG_GRP_HASH can be disabled to remove support for hashes in this configuration. SMP server in applications must support sending hashes.

bootable: bool | None

True if image has bootable flag set.

This field does not have to be present if false.

pending: bool | None

True if image is set for next swap.

This field does not have to be present if false.

confirmed: bool | None

True if image has been confirmed.

This field does not have to be present if false.

active: bool | None

True if image is currently active application

This field does not have to be present if false.

permanent: bool | None

True if image is to stay in primary slot after the next boot.

This does not have to be present if false.

@field_validator('hash')
@classmethod
def cast_bytes( cls, v: bytes | None, _: pydantic_core.core_schema.ValidationInfo) -> HashBytes | None: 
100    @field_validator("hash")
101    @classmethod
102    def cast_bytes(cls, v: bytes | None, _: ValidationInfo) -> HashBytes | None:
103        if v is None:
104            return None
105        return HashBytes(v)

class ImageStatesWriteRequest(smp.message.WriteRequest): 
130class ImageStatesWriteRequest(message.WriteRequest):
131    """Set the state of an image.
132
133    If “confirm” is false or not provided, an image with the “hash” will be set
134    for test, which means that it will not be marked as permanent and upon hard
135    reset the previous application will be restored to the primary slot. In case
136    when “confirm” is true, the “hash” is optional as the currently running
137    application will be assumed as target for confirmation.
138    """
139
140    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
141    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.ImageManagement.STATE
142
143    hash: bytes | None = None
144    """SHA256 hash of the image header and body."""
145    confirm: bool = False
146    """Confirm the image given by hash.
147
148    CAUTION: it is dangerous to confirm the image before it has been booted!
149
150    Setting this to true will mark the image as confirmed before it has been
151    booted, which can brick the device.  Zephyr provides hooks for confirming
152    the image from within the application, so this is not necessary for normal
153    operation.
154    """

Set the state of an image.

If “confirm” is false or not provided, an image with the “hash” will be set for test, which means that it will not be marked as permanent and upon hard reset the previous application will be restored to the primary slot. In case when “confirm” is true, the “hash” is optional as the currently running application will be assumed as target for confirmation.

hash: bytes | None

SHA256 hash of the image header and body.

confirm: bool

Confirm the image given by hash.

CAUTION: it is dangerous to confirm the image before it has been booted!

Setting this to true will mark the image as confirmed before it has been booted, which can brick the device. Zephyr provides hooks for confirming the image from within the application, so this is not necessary for normal operation.

class ImageUploadWriteRequest(smp.message.WriteRequest): 
161class ImageUploadWriteRequest(message.WriteRequest):
162    """Upload an image to the device.
163
164    The image is uploaded in chunks, with each chunk being sent in a separate
165    request. The first request must include the image's length and image number.
166    """
167
168    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
169    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.ImageManagement.UPLOAD
170
171    off: int
172    """The offset of the data chunk in this request."""
173    data: bytes
174    """The data chunk to write."""
175    image: int | None = None
176    """Image number.
177
178    It does not have to appear in request at all, in which case it is assumed to
179    be 0. Should only be present when `off` is 0.
180    """
181    len: int | None = None
182    """The length of the image.
183
184    Required when `off` is 0, otherwise ignored.
185    """
186    sha: bytes | None = None
187    """SHA256 hash of the image.
188
189    This is used to identify an upload session (e.g. to allow to continue
190    a broken session), and for image verification purposes. This must be a full
191    SHA256 hash of the whole image being uploaded, or not included if the hash
192    is not available (in which case, upload session continuation and image
193    verification functionality will be unavailable). Should only be present when
194    “off” is 0.
195    """
196    upgrade: bool | None = None
197    """Optional flag that states that only upgrade should be allowed.
198
199    If the version of uploaded software is not higher then already on a device,
200    the image upload will be rejected. Zephyr compares major, minor and
201    revision (x.y.z) by default unless `CONFIG_MCUMGR_GRP_IMG_VERSION_CMP_USE_BUILD_NUMBER`
202    is set, whereby it will compare build numbers too. Should only be present
203    when “off” is 0.
204    """

Upload an image to the device.

The image is uploaded in chunks, with each chunk being sent in a separate request. The first request must include the image's length and image number.

off: int

The offset of the data chunk in this request.

data: bytes

The data chunk to write.

image: int | None

Image number.

It does not have to appear in request at all, in which case it is assumed to be 0. Should only be present when off is 0.

len: int | None

The length of the image.

Required when off is 0, otherwise ignored.

sha: bytes | None

SHA256 hash of the image.

This is used to identify an upload session (e.g. to allow to continue a broken session), and for image verification purposes. This must be a full SHA256 hash of the whole image being uploaded, or not included if the hash is not available (in which case, upload session continuation and image verification functionality will be unavailable). Should only be present when “off” is 0.

upgrade: bool | None

Optional flag that states that only upgrade should be allowed.

If the version of uploaded software is not higher then already on a device, the image upload will be rejected. Zephyr compares major, minor and revision (x.y.z) by default unless CONFIG_MCUMGR_GRP_IMG_VERSION_CMP_USE_BUILD_NUMBER is set, whereby it will compare build numbers too. Should only be present when “off” is 0.

Inherited Members
smp.message._MessageBase
header
version
sequence
smp_data
BYTES

class ImageUploadWriteResponse(smp.message.WriteResponse): 
207class ImageUploadWriteResponse(message.WriteResponse):
208    """Success response to an image upload request."""
209
210    _GROUP_ID = header.GroupId.IMAGE_MANAGEMENT
211    _COMMAND_ID = header.CommandId.ImageManagement.UPLOAD
212
213    off: int | None = None
214    """The portion of the upload that has been completed, in 8-bit bytes.
215
216    This is the offset of the next byte to be written. If the offset is equal to
217    the length of the image, the upload is complete.
218    """
219
220    match: bool | None = None
221    """Indicates if the uploaded data successfully matches the provided SHA256.
222
223    Only sent in the final packet if CONFIG_IMG_ENABLE_IMAGE_CHECK is enabled.
224    """
225
226    rc: int | None = None
227    """Legacy field that contains a return code; possibly `MGMT_ERR`.
228
229    This field may be present on old SMP server implementations or new SMP
230    server implementations that have set
231    `CONFIG_MCUMGR_SMP_LEGACY_RC_BEHAVIOUR=y` for backwards compatibility with
232    old SMP clients.
233
234    Note that we are not validating this field because we don't necessarily
235    trust the server to send us valid values. If this value is present, then it
236    indicates use of an SMP server that is out of spec and interpretation of the
237    value should be done with reference to that server's source code, rather
238    that the SMP specification.
239
240    Zephyr source code reference: https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/blob/91a1e706535b2f99433280513c5bc66dfb918506/subsys/mgmt/mcumgr/grp/img_mgmt/src/img_mgmt.c#L397-L400
241    """  # noqa: E501

Success response to an image upload request.

off: int | None

The portion of the upload that has been completed, in 8-bit bytes.

This is the offset of the next byte to be written. If the offset is equal to the length of the image, the upload is complete.

match: bool | None

Indicates if the uploaded data successfully matches the provided SHA256.

Only sent in the final packet if CONFIG_IMG_ENABLE_IMAGE_CHECK is enabled.

rc: int | None

Legacy field that contains a return code; possibly MGMT_ERR.

This field may be present on old SMP server implementations or new SMP server implementations that have set CONFIG_MCUMGR_SMP_LEGACY_RC_BEHAVIOUR=y for backwards compatibility with old SMP clients.

Note that we are not validating this field because we don't necessarily trust the server to send us valid values. If this value is present, then it indicates use of an SMP server that is out of spec and interpretation of the value should be done with reference to that server's source code, rather that the SMP specification.

Zephyr source code reference: https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/blob/91a1e706535b2f99433280513c5bc66dfb918506/subsys/mgmt/mcumgr/grp/img_mgmt/src/img_mgmt.c#L397-L400

@unique
class IMG_MGMT_ERR(enum.IntEnum): 
261@unique
262class IMG_MGMT_ERR(IntEnum):
263    """Image management error codes."""
264
265    OK = 0
266    """No error, this is implied if there is no ret value in the response"""
267
268    UNKNOWN = 1
269    """Unknown error occurred."""
270
271    FLASH_CONFIG_QUERY_FAIL = 2
272    """Failed to query flash area configuration."""
273
274    NO_IMAGE = 3
275    """There is no image in the slot."""
276
277    NO_TLVS = 4
278    """The image in the slot has no TLVs (tag, length, value)."""
279
280    INVALID_TLV = 5
281    """The image in the slot has an invalid TLV type and/or length."""
282
283    TLV_MULTIPLE_HASHES_FOUND = 6
284    """The image in the slot has multiple hash TLVs, which is invalid."""
285
286    TLV_INVALID_SIZE = 7
287    """The image in the slot has an invalid TLV size."""
288
289    HASH_NOT_FOUND = 8
290    """The image in the slot does not have a hash TLV, which is required."""
291
292    NO_FREE_SLOT = 9
293    """There is no free slot to place the image."""
294
295    FLASH_OPEN_FAILED = 10
296    """Flash area opening failed."""
297
298    FLASH_READ_FAILED = 11
299    """Flash area reading failed."""
300
301    FLASH_WRITE_FAILED = 12
302    """Flash area writing failed."""
303
304    FLASH_ERASE_FAILED = 13
305    """Flash area erase failed."""
306
307    INVALID_SLOT = 14
308    """The provided slot is not valid."""
309
310    NO_FREE_MEMORY = 15
311    """Insufficient heap memory (malloc failed)."""
312
313    FLASH_CONTEXT_ALREADY_SET = 16
314    """The flash context is already set."""
315
316    FLASH_CONTEXT_NOT_SET = 17
317    """The flash context is not set."""
318
319    FLASH_AREA_DEVICE_NULL = 18
320    """The device for the flash area is NULL."""
321
322    INVALID_PAGE_OFFSET = 19
323    """The offset for a page number is invalid."""
324
325    INVALID_OFFSET = 20
326    """The offset parameter was not provided and is required."""
327
328    INVALID_LENGTH = 21
329    """The length parameter was not provided and is required."""
330
331    INVALID_IMAGE_HEADER = 22
332    """The image length is smaller than the size of an image header."""
333
334    INVALID_IMAGE_HEADER_MAGIC = 23
335    """The image header magic value does not match the expected value."""
336
337    INVALID_HASH = 24
338    """The hash parameter provided is not valid."""
339
340    INVALID_FLASH_ADDRESS = 25
341    """The image load address does not match the address of the flash area."""
342
343    VERSION_GET_FAILED = 26
344    """Failed to get version of currently running application."""
345
346    CURRENT_VERSION_IS_NEWER = 27
347    """The currently running application is newer than the version being uploaded."""
348
349    IMAGE_ALREADY_PENDING = 28
350    """There is already an image operating pending."""
351
352    INVALID_IMAGE_VECTOR_TABLE = 29
353    """The image vector table is invalid."""
354
355    INVALID_IMAGE_TOO_LARGE = 30
356    """The image it too large to fit."""
357
358    INVALID_IMAGE_DATA_OVERRUN = 31
359    """The amount of data sent is larger than the provided image size."""
360
361    IMAGE_CONFIRMATION_DENIED = 32
362    """Confirmation of image has been denied"""
363
364    IMAGE_SETTING_TEST_TO_ACTIVE_DENIED = 33
365    """Setting test to active slot is not allowed"""

Image management error codes.

OK = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.OK: 0>

No error, this is implied if there is no ret value in the response

UNKNOWN = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.UNKNOWN: 1>

Unknown error occurred.

FLASH_CONFIG_QUERY_FAIL = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.FLASH_CONFIG_QUERY_FAIL: 2>

Failed to query flash area configuration.

NO_IMAGE = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.NO_IMAGE: 3>

There is no image in the slot.

NO_TLVS = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.NO_TLVS: 4>

The image in the slot has no TLVs (tag, length, value).

INVALID_TLV = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_TLV: 5>

The image in the slot has an invalid TLV type and/or length.

TLV_MULTIPLE_HASHES_FOUND = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.TLV_MULTIPLE_HASHES_FOUND: 6>

The image in the slot has multiple hash TLVs, which is invalid.

TLV_INVALID_SIZE = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.TLV_INVALID_SIZE: 7>

The image in the slot has an invalid TLV size.

HASH_NOT_FOUND = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.HASH_NOT_FOUND: 8>

The image in the slot does not have a hash TLV, which is required.

NO_FREE_SLOT = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.NO_FREE_SLOT: 9>

There is no free slot to place the image.

FLASH_OPEN_FAILED = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.FLASH_OPEN_FAILED: 10>

Flash area opening failed.

FLASH_READ_FAILED = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.FLASH_READ_FAILED: 11>

Flash area reading failed.

FLASH_WRITE_FAILED = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.FLASH_WRITE_FAILED: 12>

Flash area writing failed.

FLASH_ERASE_FAILED = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.FLASH_ERASE_FAILED: 13>

Flash area erase failed.

INVALID_SLOT = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_SLOT: 14>

The provided slot is not valid.

NO_FREE_MEMORY = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.NO_FREE_MEMORY: 15>

Insufficient heap memory (malloc failed).

FLASH_CONTEXT_ALREADY_SET = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.FLASH_CONTEXT_ALREADY_SET: 16>

The flash context is already set.

FLASH_CONTEXT_NOT_SET = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.FLASH_CONTEXT_NOT_SET: 17>

The flash context is not set.

FLASH_AREA_DEVICE_NULL = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.FLASH_AREA_DEVICE_NULL: 18>

The device for the flash area is NULL.

INVALID_PAGE_OFFSET = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_PAGE_OFFSET: 19>

The offset for a page number is invalid.

INVALID_OFFSET = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_OFFSET: 20>

The offset parameter was not provided and is required.

INVALID_LENGTH = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_LENGTH: 21>

The length parameter was not provided and is required.

INVALID_IMAGE_HEADER = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_IMAGE_HEADER: 22>

The image length is smaller than the size of an image header.

INVALID_IMAGE_HEADER_MAGIC = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_IMAGE_HEADER_MAGIC: 23>

The image header magic value does not match the expected value.

INVALID_HASH = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_HASH: 24>

The hash parameter provided is not valid.

INVALID_FLASH_ADDRESS = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_FLASH_ADDRESS: 25>

The image load address does not match the address of the flash area.

VERSION_GET_FAILED = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.VERSION_GET_FAILED: 26>

Failed to get version of currently running application.

CURRENT_VERSION_IS_NEWER = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.CURRENT_VERSION_IS_NEWER: 27>

The currently running application is newer than the version being uploaded.

IMAGE_ALREADY_PENDING = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.IMAGE_ALREADY_PENDING: 28>

There is already an image operating pending.

INVALID_IMAGE_VECTOR_TABLE = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_IMAGE_VECTOR_TABLE: 29>

The image vector table is invalid.

INVALID_IMAGE_TOO_LARGE = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_IMAGE_TOO_LARGE: 30>

The image it too large to fit.

INVALID_IMAGE_DATA_OVERRUN = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.INVALID_IMAGE_DATA_OVERRUN: 31>

The amount of data sent is larger than the provided image size.

IMAGE_CONFIRMATION_DENIED = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.IMAGE_CONFIRMATION_DENIED: 32>

Confirmation of image has been denied

IMAGE_SETTING_TEST_TO_ACTIVE_DENIED = <IMG_MGMT_ERR.IMAGE_SETTING_TEST_TO_ACTIVE_DENIED: 33>

Setting test to active slot is not allowed
